Remote access via SSH
You can get a remote shell on echo using
$ ssh user@echo.bumc.bu.edu
Where user is your BU username. You can also authenticate using an SSH key, so you won’t have to enter your password as often: if you don’t already have an SSH key pair, generate it
$ ssh-keygen
then copy your publick key to the workstation
ssh-copy-id user@echo.bumc.bu.edu
You are now able to login without password.

Navigation Sidebar
The sidebar is automatically generated from the available documents.

Navigation item titles will be read from the title field of documents.
Sub-directories will create sections and will be automatically titled based on the directory name (including adding capitalization and substituting spaces for dashes and underscores). Use an index.qmd in the directory to provide an explicit title if you don’t like the automatic one.
Order is alphabetical (by filename) unless a numeric order field is provided in document metadata.
